references.paper_title: Social LSTM: Human Trajectory Prediction in Crowded Spaces
references.reason: This paper is foundational for pedestrian trajectory prediction, introducing the Social LSTM model which is a benchmark and starting point for many subsequent works.

references.paper_title: Social GAN: Socially Acceptable Trajectories with Generative Adversarial Networks
references.reason: This paper introduced the use of Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) for trajectory prediction, which is a significant departure from deterministic approaches and allows for modeling the inherent uncertainty in human movement.

references.paper_title: Trajectron++: Dynamically-Feasible Trajectory Forecasting with Heterogeneous Data
references.reason: This paper significantly advanced the field by introducing a more sophisticated model called Trajectron++, capable of handling diverse data types and more accurately reflecting the complexities of real-world scenarios.

references.paper_title: AgentFormer: Agent-aware transformers for socio-temporal multi-agent forecasting
references.reason: This paper introduced the use of transformers, a powerful deep learning architecture, to trajectory prediction, improving performance and enabling more complex interaction modeling.

references.paper_title: Learning Transferable Visual Models From Natural Language Supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is a crucial component of the TrajCLIP method and demonstrates the power of using contrastive learning to align feature spaces from different modalities, improving model performance and generalization.
